meanings.definition: The quality or state of being suppressible.
meanings.sent1: Her suppressibilities made it difficult for her to speak up in class.
meanings.sent2: The suppressibilities of his emotions were evident in his calm demeanor.
meanings.sent3: The cat's suppressibilities were put to the test when it saw a mouse.
meanings.sent4: The suppressibilities of the volcano's eruption were finally released.
meanings.sent5: The suppressibilities of the situation were overwhelming, causing her to stay silent.

meanings.sent1: The suppressibilities of the noise made it hard to concentrate.
meanings.sent2: He struggled with the suppressibilities of his anger during the argument.
meanings.sent3: The suppressibilities of the giggles were too much to contain.
meanings.sent4: The suppressibilities of the truth finally came to light.
meanings.sent5: The suppressibilities of the secret were too great, leading to its eventual disclosure.
